meanings.definition: A person appointed or authorized to act as a substitute or agent for another.
meanings.sent1: During the meeting, the deputies took over when the leader had to leave early.
meanings.sent2: The deputies in the office are responsible for handling important tasks in the absence of the manager.
meanings.sent3: The deputies decided to play a game of 'office swap' where they pretended to be each other for a day.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the deputies were portrayed as the heroes who saved the day in the absence of the main character.
meanings.sent5: The image of the deputies rushing in to help created a lasting impression on the audience.

meanings.definition: A member of a legislative body chosen to represent a particular constituency.
meanings.sent1: The deputies from different regions gathered to discuss important laws in the parliament.
meanings.sent2: As a deputy, she worked hard to address the concerns of her constituents in the community.
meanings.sent3: The deputies jokingly referred to themselves as the 'superheroes of legislation' during a break.
meanings.sent4: In the political cartoon, the deputies were depicted as chess pieces moving strategically on the board of governance.
meanings.sent5: The dedication shown by the deputies in serving their constituents was truly admirable.
